content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Station at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (24.0, -15.0) mining coal
- Wooden chest (23.5, -16.5) storing coal with 236 units

### Copper Processing Line at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Output chest (20.5, 21.5) storing 159 copper ore
- Stone furnace (24.0, 20.0) for smelting
- Input chest (22.5, 21.5) with 397 copper ore
- Output chest (24.5, 17.5) storing 53 copper plates
- Burner inserter (24.5, 18.5) moving items from furnace to output chest
- Burner inserter (22.5, 20.5) moving items from input chest to furnace

### Iron Processing Line at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (-14.0, 23.0) mining iron ore
- Wooden chest (-14.5, 21.5) storing 103 iron ore
- Two stone furnaces (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0) for smelting

ERROR TIPS

### Furnace Input Issues
- Ensure inserters are properly oriented to feed materials into furnaces. Multiple furnaces showing "no ingredients" despite available ore in nearby chests
- Check that inserter pickup and drop positions align with input chests and furnace input positions

### Resource Flow Optimization
- Consider optimizing the placement of chests and inserters to minimize transport distance
- Ensure proper spacing between components to allow for efficient material movement

### Furnace Fuel Management
- Monitor furnace fuel levels - one furnace showing "furnace fuel source is full" warning which may indicate inefficient fuel distribution
- Consider implementing a more balanced fuel distribution system
